conditions.name: Admission Rescheduling Criteria
conditions.description: Condition for rescheduling admission to the CRU.
conditions.text: Admission can be rescheduled if PG level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1.

conditions.name: Insulin Infusion Stop Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria to stop the insulin infusion used to induce hypoglycemia.
conditions.text: Insulin infusion is stopped once bedside PG is <60 mg/dL.

conditions.name: PG Monitoring Frequency
conditions.description: Rules for the frequency of bedside plasma glucose monitoring based on the current PG level.
conditions.text: Bedside PG monitoring will be conducted no more than 10 minutes apart while bedside PG is â‰¥90 mg/dL and no more than 5 minutes apart when bedside PG is <90 mg/dL.

conditions.name: Interim Safety Review Trigger
conditions.description: The study will pause for a safety review after a specific number of patients have completed Period 2.
conditions.text: Safety data will be reviewed after the first 6 patients (regardless of type of diabetes) are administered LY900018 in Period 2.

conditions.name: Study Continuation Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for continuing the study after the interim safety review.
conditions.text: If no clinically significant safety findings for treatment or study procedure are noted, the remaining patients will be dosed.

conditions.name: TE ADA Additional Follow-up Trigger
conditions.description: Criteria for initiating additional follow-up for immunogenicity.
conditions.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

transitionRules.name: Patient Replacement
transitionRules.text: If patients discontinue from the study before completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome for any reason, the patient may be replaced.

transitionRules.name: Transition to TE ADA Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Patients with TE ADA at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

transitionRules.name: Continuation of Inadvertently Enrolled Patient
transitionRules.text: If the sponsor or investigator identifies a patient who did not meet enrollment criteria... a discussion must occur... If both agree it is medically appropriate to continue, the investigator must obtain documented approval from the Lilly CP/CRP to allow the inadvertently enrolled patient to continue in the study.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation from TE ADA Follow-up
transitionRules.text: Additional follow-up continues until the titer returns to baseline (ie, returns to within a single 2-fold dilution of the baseline titer) or until 1 year after the last dose of study treatment.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Patient Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The patient, or legal representative, requests to be withdrawn from the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Decision to Discontinue
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The investigator decides that the patient should be discontinued from the study for any reason.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for External Reasons
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Discontinuation due to enrollment in another clinical study, or for medical, safety, or regulatory reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A patient will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Termination for Safety
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Following the review of the safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1, the study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety in the opinion of the Investigator and sponsor.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation of Inadvertently Enrolled Patient
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A patient who did not meet enrollment criteria may be discontinued after discussion between the investigator and sponsor.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Interim Safety Review Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to pause and review safety data from the first 6 patients completing Period 2, and to decide whether to continue dosing the remaining patients or stop the study.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Inadvertent Enrollment Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point upon discovery of an inadvertently enrolled patient to determine if the patient may continue in the study.
